Focus on metrics/loaders/base.py interface.

title: Parallelize LLM calls in investment materialization
description: Refactor work_graph/investment/materialize.py to batch and parallelize LLM categorization. Current implementation (lines 355-400) calls categorize_text_bundle() sequentially for each component. Use asyncio.gather() with concurrency limit (e.g., 5-10 concurrent calls). Consider batching multiple components into single LLM call where feasible.
close_reason: Implemented parallel LLM categorization with asyncio.gather and semaphore (llm_concurrency config)

title: Document NotRequired loader fields - guaranteed vs best-effort
description: Add documentation to metrics/schemas.py clarifying which NotRequired fields are guaranteed to be present vs best-effort. Document: (1) when each field is populated, (2) default value semantics (null vs 0 vs missing), (3) which loaders populate which fields. Currently 17+ NotRequired fields with no documentation.
close_reason: Added docstrings clarifying NotRequired field contracts

title: task: Fixtures validation - ensure synthetic work items + commits generate non-zero Phase 2 metrics
description: Roadmap item: Ensure synthetic work items + commits generate non-zero Phase 2 metrics (cycle_time, lead_time, throughput, etc.). Currently fixture generation may produce zero metrics due to missing started_at/completed_at or edge cases.
close_reason: Added Phase 2 metrics validation to run_fixtures_validation(): checks cycle_time_hours, flow_efficiency, predictability_score, wip_congestion_ratio, new_items_count

title: Implement chunked processing for metrics in-memory aggregation
description: Refactor metrics/compute.py to use streaming/chunked aggregation instead of unbounded in-memory dicts. Current dataclass uses mutable Set/List fields that grow unbounded for large repos. Consider: (1) chunked day-by-day processing, (2) streaming aggregation with periodic flush, (3) database-side aggregation where possible.
close_reason: Implemented chunked processing via sliding window cache and per-day work items loading

refactor: Rename admin CLI commands to subcommand groups (admin users/orgs <action>)
description:
Refactor admin CLI commands from flat structure to subcommand groups:

**Current:**
- admin create-user
- admin create-org  
- admin list-users
- admin list-orgs

**Target:**
- admin users create
- admin users list
- admin orgs create
- admin orgs list

This follows the pattern of other CLI tools (kubectl, gh, etc.) and makes the command structure more intuitive.

title: Fixtures: populate work_item_state_durations_daily for elapsed time breakdown
description:
The elapsed time breakdown flame view shows 'No flame data available' when using fixture data because work_item_state_durations_daily is not populated during fixture generation.

**Root cause:**
- Fixture runner calls `run_daily_metrics_job()` from job_daily.py
- But state_durations are written by `run_work_items_metrics_job()` in job_work_items.py
- This job is not called during fixture generation

**Fix needed:**
In fixtures/runner.py, after run_daily_metrics_job(), also call:
```python
from dev_health_ops.metrics.job_work_items import run_work_items_metrics_job
await run_work_items_metrics_job(db_url=ns.db, ...)
```

**Affected endpoint:** GET /api/v1/flame/aggregated?mode=cycle_breakdown

**Tables:**
- work_item_state_durations_daily (day, team_id, status, duration_hours, items_touched)
close_reason: Fixed in PR #287

title: Optimize work graph builder O(n*m) performance
description: Refactor work_graph/builder.py _build_issue_pr_edges() to use O(1) hash lookups instead of nested loops. Current implementation (lines 310-450) iterates all PRs and scans lookups for each. Pre-build indexed dictionaries at load time. Consider chunked processing for very large repos.
close_reason: Implemented binary search optimization in _build_heuristic_issue_pr_edges (O(n*m) → O(n*log(m)))

close_reason: Keeping PR #307 - continuing with feature branch for settings infrastructure

title: Populate file_metrics_daily for code hotspots flame view
description:
The code hotspots flame view shows 'No flame data available' because file_metrics_daily table is never populated.

**Root cause:**
- `write_file_metrics()` method exists in all sinks (clickhouse, mongo, postgres, sqlite)
- But it is NEVER called anywhere in the codebase
- `fetch_code_hotspots()` in aggregated_flame.py queries this empty table

**Fix needed:**
- Identify source of file churn data (likely git processor or blame data)
- Call `sink.write_file_metrics()` during metrics computation
- Ensure fixture generation also populates this table

**Affected endpoint:** GET /api/v1/flame/aggregated?mode=code_hotspots

**Tables:**
- file_metrics_daily (day, repo_id, path, churn, ...)
close_reason: Fixed in PR #287
